subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
author: Fransen, Debbie
full_text:
------_=_NextPart_001_01C9E063.B3E140C7
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Exactly my point... You don't charge anything for the boxes
and Chris Moon =
charges people for using it....
If it's not perfected then Chris shouldn't =
charge either......
If he wasn't so public with it, then people like me wou=
ldn't dislike him
so much.
 
The only people that have your boxes (that the=
 public hear about)
are the well known paranormal groups and famous people.=

I am sure that you have given boxes to researchers who are not in the
popu=
lar
paranormal community ,and don't want to be. Those are the ones that
sho=
uld
get respect.  And of course YOU are well respected by us lowly
research=
ers. ( Kissin up , so you won't get mad)
 
And I am sure that you are sick =
of hearing about Chris Moon and how
alot of people thinks he sucks. And eve=
ryone wants a box......
But you have to expect that. You are the only one o=
ut there that is
honest and
doesn't want to be famous.
I know this is like =
beating a dead horse, so I will shut up now.... :)
 
 


__________________=
______________

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om] On Behalf
Of Frank Sumption
Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 9:22 AM
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.





 Kee=
p in mind the money thing works two ways, I also don't sell/charge
for the =
boxes. Someday I will--when it's perfected!
 
 Frank-S


On Fri, May 29, 20=
09 at 6:16 AM, Fransen, Debbie
<debbie.fransen@... <mailto:debbie.fra=
nsen@...> > wrote:




	
	Of course Chris Moon speaks highly of him.
=
	Frank has made him lots of money.

________________________________

	From=
: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
[mailto:EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com <mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> ] On
Behalf Of Elaine Coat=
es
	Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 3:49 PM 

	To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <ma=
ilto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
	
	Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip con=
fig.
	


	
	Okay, then could I have a copy of the new schematic when you ge=
t
it drawn?  That would be even better.  Where are you from?  Chris Moon
sp=
eaks highly of you.
	

	
________________________________

	From: Frank Sum=
ption <purplealiengirl@...
<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> >
	To: =
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
	Sent: Thursday, =
May 28, 2009 2:29:09 PM
	Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
	
	
=

	Besides--I didn't like that radio design, it's too complex, and
the docum=
entation is screwy. I did a simpler radio last night that
should be better,=
 simpler, cheaper, and clearer sound. 
	
	
	On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 AM=
, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@
yahoo.com <mailto:cozykat2003@...> > wr=
ote:
	



		
		The jpg for this schematic is kind of blurry in places.
Is t=
here any way a more clear copy could be send to me? I would be
forever grat=
eful.  Thanks Frank - Elaine
		

		
________________________________

		Fro=
m: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com
<mailto:purplealiengirl@gmail=
.com> >
		
		To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> =

		Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 12:55:00 AM
		Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Differ=
ent chip config.
		
		

		
		http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/
<http://p=
urplealiengirl.tripod.com/>  
		 
		 However, it's constantly changing. The=
 radio I made
tonight is very simple, and can significantly simplify constr=
uction. I
used to make the sweep and amplifier circuits, then use a commerc=
ial
radio, like the 12-469, as a tuner. 
		 
		 The MK484 is follwed by a c=
ouple high impedence op amp
stages to bring the audio up to line levels. I =
haven't had time to do
schematic yet. I draw the schematics with MS paint, =
and they are stored
as jpeg images, which isn't the best, but it makes them=
 e-mailable. 
		 
		 Frank-S
		
		
		On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 PM, Elain=
e Coates
<cozykat2003@ yahoo.com <mailto:cozykat2003@...> > wrote:
		=




			
			Hi folks, I just joined this group.  I was
recently at the Lizzy=
 Borden house in Massachusetts with Chris Moon and
had a session with Frank=
's Box.  The results were astounding.  Is this
the newest schematic for Fra=
nk's box?  If so, is there a way to get a
clearer copy of it?  My son said =
he would build one for me and I have
been searching for the schematic.  Can=
 anyone help? - Elaine
			

			
________________________________

			From: =
Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com
<mailto:purplealiengirl@...=
m> >
			
			To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com
<mailto:evp-itc@yahoogroups.com> ;=
 grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com
<mailto:grassharp@yahoogroups.com>  

			Sent: =
Wednesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
			Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip con=
fig. [1
Attachment]
			


			
			 I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 la=
yout,
so I'm going to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now=
 on
pin 12-11, this is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output,
w=
hich feeds pin 1.
			 
			 'case anyone cares. 
			 
			 F-S

			

			

			=


			

			

			

			

			


		

		

		

		

		

		


	

	

	

	

	

	

	


=
